Articles.Content: Can I set and also unset targets? Also, can I target bodies with the mod, or only vessels?

5 hours ago, Daniel Prates said:

Can I set and also unset targets? Also, can I target bodies with the mod, or only vessels?

It’s designed for vessels, of any type, but not celestial bodies.

and I don't understand about unsetting targets, you don’t need a mod for that.

27 minutes ago, linuxgurugamer said:

It’s designed for vessels, of any type, but not celestial bodies.

and I don't understand about unsetting targets, you don’t need a mod for that.

I know. Would be nice to do it clicking the same button you use to select a vessel though, specially if you already have the mod interface open in front of your face.

What is your speedy method of unselecting a target, btw?

3 minutes ago, Daniel Prates said:

What is your speedy method of unselecting a target, btw?

Double-click active vessel, or target vessel if it's right there. Or in a pinch in map mode target the world or orbit nearby and then untarget it.

11 minutes ago, 5thHorseman said:

Double-click active vessel, or target vessel if it's right there. Or in a pinch in map mode target the world or orbit nearby and then untarget it.

That is what I mean. Maybe you guys don't think its all that awful, but in many situations I find the interface too cluttered to allow easy selecting and unselecting of targets. Specially so when your target is near other craft or bodies. A screen where you sort all available targets and select the one you want makes even more sense if you can also unselect a target with the mere clicking of a button in the very same GUI you already have oppened in front of your face.  Selecting target bodies and unselecting them makes equal sense to me. 

Edit. I made similar comments in the targetron thread, with similar feedback, so apparently I am alone in this. Oh, well!

Edited July 13, 2019 by Daniel Prates
I’ve added this request as an enhancement. But, since it was just rebuilt for 1.7.2, I have a lot of other mods which need updating, so may be a while

10 hours ago, Daniel Prates said:

I know. Would be nice to do it clicking the same button you use to select a vessel though, specially if you already have the mod interface open in front of your face.

What is your speedy method of unselecting a target, btw? ﻿

I use KER for that...it provides a target selector and while you have an active target, it will be unselected as soon as you click on "Go Back to Target Selection"

Spoiler

Are there filters for relays/surface  science?

Further troubles. Either im wrong in assuming I can divide 360 by X amount of satellites to get an even spread around the planet. Or by time im getting to the end off my 20 satellites they have drifted in the time it takes to switch and change each orbit. As I came around to the 20th satellite there was a large gap between the first and last. I remember seeing a mod in the past that could manage satellite constellations. Im wondering if there's a way to automatically place each 20 crafts into an even spread.

Edited November 19, 2019 by Motokid600

First off, 20!? That's a crazy high number of satellites You really only need 3 or 4 for full coverage. However, if you're really wanting to do 20 just for fun, continue below.

  1. 360/20 is 18, so you want your satellites 18 degrees apart.
  2. There IS a mod that helps you with satellite but I literally cannot think of its name which is driving me a bit mad. The problem is I've never used it as I don't bother with relay networks and instead just keep throwing satellites at the problem until coverage is good enough.
  3. One mod that's not made for this but that would allow you to do it is HyperEdit. Just go to each satellite and paste in the exact values, and then just keep adding 18 to each satellite's LAN (I think that's the one, it's been a while since I fiddled with HyperEdit too) until you get thorugh all 20. If you do them all one after the other the error from their orbiting should be low enough that you won't even notice it.
I know im doing it just for fun. And to have something to look at down on the ground with DistantObjects HyperEdit may allow me to do it faster. Ill try it, ty.
